5.00.text: These people are amongst the greatest quiz players in Britain.

11.00.text: Together they make up the Eggheads,

12.00.text: arguably the most formidable quiz team in the country.

18.00.text: The question is, can they be beaten?

24.00.text: Welcome to Eggheads, the show where a team of five quiz challengers

28.00.text: pit their wits against possibly the greatest quiz team in Britain.

33.00.text: Was that a good enough build-up?

35.00.text: DAVE: Yeah, it's good. Like that. PAT: It's a start.

37.00.text: Have to work on toning it down, I think.

38.00.text: Taking on our quiz Goliaths today

44.00.text: This team all take part in league quizzes once a week so they're pretty handy.

47.00.text: They're at the Spotland Social Club

49.00.text: and they take their name from the famous Rochdale Pioneers,

52.00.text: known for forming the original co-operative movement.

56.00.text: Hi. I'm Steve, I'm a retired postal worker.

59.00.text: Hiya. I'm Mick, I'm a retired health and safety consultant.

63.00.text: Hi. I'm Janice, I'm a retired primary school teacher.

67.00.text: Hi, I'm Pete, and I'm a caretaker.

70.00.text: Hi. I'm Paul, I'm a cladder.

73.00.text: So Steve, team, welcome. Good to see you. Hi, Jeremy.

76.00.text: So proper quizzing goes on here, right?

80.00.text: I don't know whether you'd call it proper. We try.

84.00.text: And just before we start, the original co-operative movement,

87.00.text: the Rochdale Pioneers, it's an interesting back reference. What should we know about them?

95.00.text: as a challenge to what was going on

97.00.text: with a lot of shopkeepers at the time who were

100.00.text: polluting the flour, putting stones in sacks of potatoes and all the rest of it,

105.00.text: so that the people who owned the co-operative ran the co-operative,

110.00.text: and made sure that all the customers got a good deal. OK.

113.00.text: And any profits that were made went back to the customers.

115.00.text: OK... And it's an idea that's spread worldwide.

118.00.text: Lovely. And any profits made tonight...stay with you. Yes, please.

122.00.text: Every day there is ?1,000 worth of cash up for grabs for our Challengers.

126.00.text: However, if they fail to defeat the Eggheads,

128.00.text: the prize money rolls over to the next show.

130.00.text: So, Pioneers, the Eggheads are on a roll. They've won the last 11 games.

138.00.text: So this is fun, isn't it, already?

143.00.text: Who would like this? Who wants to...

145.00.text: Might we suggest... You looking at me?

149.00.text: Yeah, but who should I take on?

158.00.text: OK, so it's going to be Mick from The Pioneers against

162.00.text: Tremendous Knowledge Dave on History. A quizzy team we've got here.

166.00.text: To ensure there's no conferring would you both please take your positions in our Question Room?

171.00.text: So, Mick, it's History. Would you like to go first or second?

174.00.text: Er, I'd like to go first, please.

179.00.text: Good luck, Mick, and here we go.

184.00.text: of the infamous ruler Vlad the Impaler?

192.00.text: Well, I think that's in present-day Romania,

214.00.text: Well, he was the one with the Crusades, Richard the Lionheart.

222.00.text: Bang on, 10 years. That's right. He was away a lot, wasn't he?

232.00.text: typically used around the time of the Norman invasion of England?

239.00.text: Ooh, I don't know this. Erm...

243.00.text: So that leaves the other two.

248.00.text: I don't think it's Thane, I'll go for Housecarl.

252.00.text: Yeah, Housecarl is spot on, well done. All right. Yeah.

272.00.text: And the only thing I'm going on is "King's town"...

278.00.text: and it's the Royal Borough of Kingston-upon-Thames

281.00.text: so I'm going to go Kingston.

286.00.text: the answer was almost in the names there.

289.00.text: Kingston is right. Well done. "King's town."

296.00.text: at which Mark Antony was defeated by the forces of Octavian,

305.00.text: Er, again I'm not quite sure of this. Erm...

661.00.text: features the numbers No Place Like London and God, That's Good!?
